Borders

On This Page

  • Border
  • Border Radius
  • Specific Corners

Border

When set, all borders default to a 1px width which can be offset using border--width-{ i }.

Class

Class Result
border

Set border.
no-border

Remove border.
border-x

Set x-axis borders (left and right).
border-y

Set y-axis borders (top and bottom).
border-t

Set top border.
border-b

Set bottom border.
border-r

Set right border.
border-l

Set left border.
border--width-{ 1-5 }

Set custom border width.
border--color-{ color }

Set border color.

Visualizer

Try this! See how to use the border utilities!

Example Card

Example Card

Example Card

Border Radius

You can add a border radius utility to any element.

Class

Class Result
rounded-1

border-radius: .25rem
rounded-2

border-radius: .5rem
rounded-3

border-radius: 1rem
rounded-4

border-radius: 2rem
rounded-5

border-radius: 3rem
rounded-6

border-radius: 4.5rem
rounded-7

border-radius: 6.5rem

Visualizer

Try this! Change the border-radius of the card

Example Card

Specific Corners

You can specify a border-radius on a certain corner of an element. Just be sure to add the corner you want. It looks like this: rounded-tr--2. This would add border-top-right-radius: .5rem.

  • Border
  • Border Radius
  • Specific Corners
Platform UI

Built by the Ritter Insurance Marketing development team, aka RIMdev , to power our platform of staff and agent tools.

Platform UI is available on npm and uses SkellyCSS, also on npm and github

Current version 1.7.12
